channel.title: NETWORKING on EWW | ITandTEL Cloud Docs
channel.description: Recent content in NETWORKING on EWW | ITandTEL Cloud Docs

item.title: Networks
item.description:
On this page, you can find an explanation of how to create, edit, delete Networks and instructions for other steps to manage Networks in the Cloud Console.

Table of contents

  • Table of contents
    • Networks page
    • Create Network
      • Create Subnet
    • Edit Network
    • Delete Network
    • Attach Network Interface to the VM

Networks page

To get to the Networks page, select the Networking  from the VIRTUAL DATACENTER block in the side-bar menu and click the Networks TAB::

item.title: Floating IPs
item.description:
On this page, you can find an explanation of how to create, associate, edit, delete Floating IPs and instructions for other steps to manage Floating IPs in the Cloud Console.

Table of contents

  • Table of contents
    • Floating IP
    • Floating IPs page
    • Create Floating IP
    • Associate/Disassociate Floating IP
    • Edit Floating IP
    • Delete Floating IP

Floating IP

Floating IP is an IP address allocated from Public network range by request and associated with specific project. You can assign Floating IP to any of your instances provisioned in private networks. This provides great flexibility in management of your network resources.

item.title: Routers
item.description:
On this page, you can find an explanation of how to create, edit, delete Routers and how to manage Interfaces inside them in Cloud Console.

Table of contents

  • Table of contents
    • Routers
    • Routers page
    • Create Router
      • Add Interface to the Router
      • Add custom Route to the Router
    • Edit Router
    • Delete Router

Routers

Router is an important infrastructure component that can come in handy when you need to:

  • Provide access to the internet for instances provisioned in a private network;
  • Interconnect two or more networks;
  • Manage routes for traffic in advanced network scenarios;

Routers page

To get to the Routers page, select the Networking from the VIRTUAL DATACENTER block in the side-bar menu and click the Routers TAB:

Subnets page

To open the Subnets page, go to Networking page and click on the Name of the corresponding Network:

On this page you can find:

  • panel with available quick actions for the selected Network:

item.title: Load Balancers
item.description:
On this page, you can find an explanation of how to create, edit, delete Load Balancer and instructions for other steps to manage it in the Cloud Console.

Table of contents

  • Table of contents
    • Introduction
    • Load Balancers page
    • Create Load Balancer
    • Load Balancer details page
      • Listeners
        • Create Listener
        • Listener details page
        • Edit Listener
        • Delete Listener
      • Pools
        • Create Pool
        • Pool details page
        • Edit Pool
        • Delete Pool
      • Pool Members
        • Add Pool Member
        • Edit Pool Member
        • Delete Pool Member
      • Health Monitors
        • Create Health Monitor
        • Edit Health Monitor
        • Delete Health Monitor
    • Edit Load Balancer
    • Associate/Disassociate Floating IP
    • Delete Load Balancer

Introduction

Load Balancer (LB) helps distribute incoming traffic across multiple backend servers to ensure high availability and better performance. It provides a single access point to your application and automatically reroutes traffic if a server becomes unavailable.

item.title: VM's Networks and Interfaces
item.description:
On this page, you can find an explanation of how to manage Networks and Interfaces, related to the selected Virtual Machine, from the Virtual Machine details page in the Cloud Console.

Table of contents

  • Table of contents
    • VM’s NETWORKS & SECURITY TAB
    • Add Interface
    • Remove Interface
    • Associate/Disassociate Floating IP

VM’s NETWORKS & SECURITY TAB

To find all Networks and Interfaces related to the selected Virtual Machine, you need:

  • open the Virtual Machines page - for this select the Virtual Machines from the VIRTUAL DATACENTER block in the side-bar menu:
